title: NOT Save messages on Server
creator: Rob_Wood
content: MS Outlook on my computer will download messages and NOT save a copy on the mail Server. I want to do this with Mozilla Firefox because my mailbox only has a limited amount of space. Can you please give me a step by step description of how to make this settings change in my Mozilla Firefox on my Android phone. Regards & Thanks Rob

title: Kvittering ?
creator: michail74
content:
Når jeg sender en mail og har markeret at jeg gerne vil have en kvittering for modtagelse, så kommer der ikke nogen. Modtageres system kan godt generere en kvittering. Når samme modtager sender en mail til mig og beder om en kvittering, så når den åbnes hos modtagere, bliver der sendt en kvittering til mig. Modtageres system er Outlook 2010. Hvad skal jeg gøre for kvittering virker når jeg beder om det i en mail jeg sender?

Hilsen Michail
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/136.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/136.0.0.0;os:Windows 11

title: Please bring back account switch behavior from K-9 6.904
creator: whitedavidp
content:
Please bring back account switch behavior from K-9 6.904.

By this I mean that when I switch accounts, say from gmail to outlook, have this happen:

(a) hide/retract the left sidebar (b) display the inbox folder of the outlook account (regardless that I was previously viewing the outbox folder in gmail)

TB 9.0 does not do this. And it forces me to do both (a) + (b) each time. This is NOT an improvement in the UI.

Thanks!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) SamsungBrowser/27.0 Chrome/125.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Android 12

title: Messages not being sent from Thunderbird Android
creator: llieb
content: Just installed Android version of Thunderbird (have been using Windows version for years). Configured server settings as usual. My ISP is Optimum. I receive messages OK, but sending messages consistently fails. The Thunderbird notification is "Failed to send some messages" "Sender refused". I saw elsewhere that another user had a similar problem with his Optonline mail account, but I did not see any resolution. Also, my Thunderbird Windows client continues to work perfectly with the same Optonline mail account. Any ideas on what to do?
